Get Married by the Mayor

  • Mayor's Office
  • Get Married by the Mayor
Congratulations on your upcoming marriage! All marriage ceremonies are performed at the Municipal Building (455 Hoes Ln) for Piscataway residents only. While the Mayor does not accept a fee for performing the ceremony, we would appreciate a $50 tax-deductible donation toward the Piscataway Community Center. We do not accept cash; a check or money order should be made payable to the Piscataway Community Center Foundation and brought with you the day of the ceremony. Since Mayor Brian C. Wahler works full-time outside of the Township, he is typically only available for marriage ceremonies one day per month. To find out what dates are available, please call the Mayor's Office at (732) 562-2301. Once you speak with the Mayor's Office and they inform you of his availability, please fill out the Marriage Ceremony Request Form and return it directly to the Mayor's Office at 455 Hoes Ln or email the completed form to the Mayor's Chief of Staff, Dana Korbman at dkorbman@piscatawaynj.org. Please note, we will not be able to guarantee your spot on the Mayor's schedule until we receive the completed form. After you receive confirmation from the Mayor's Office that you are on the Mayor's calendar, you will need to contact the Township Clerk to schedule an appointment to apply for your Marriage License. The Township Clerk can be reached at (732) 562-2310. Please contact the Mayor's Office at (732) 562-2301 if you have any questions or concerns.

You can unsubscribe at any time using the Unsubscribe link at the bottom of every email.
